content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is balancing a mini hockey stick on his hand as Chandler enters from his room carrying a bunch of bills.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay! (Joey quickly moves the hockey stick so that he’s scratching his back with it.) Listen, I’m gonna be moving out so you will be in charge of paying the rent.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Right! And when is that due?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: First of the month.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And that’s every month?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, just the months you actually want to live here.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ahhh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, here is the phone bill. (Hands it to Joey.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s our phone number. Now look, I know I kinda sprung this whole me moving out on thing, so why don’t I just—why don’t I just cover you for a while?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no! No way! Joey Tribbiani does not take charity…anymore.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s not charity, Joe…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! Forget it! Okay—I mean thanks, but I’m done taking money from you. All right, I can take of myself. Now, what’s next? Come on.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay uh, here’s the electric bill. (Hands it to him.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This is how much we pay for electric?!!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, yeah.
(Joey runs over and shuts off the lights.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, we’ll do the rest of the bills later then?

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler is talking to Phoebe about trying to give Joey some money.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So is Joey going to have to give up the apartment?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, I hope not! I tried to offer him some money, but he wouldn’t take it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, how much do you think he needs?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I figure that $1,500 would cover him for a few months, y’know? But I have to trick him into taking it so I won’t hurt his pride.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why don’t you hire him as an actor? You could have him dress up and put on little skits. Whatever you want.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well that would help the pride thing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! Wow! You look great! Wanna move in with me tomorrow?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay! (They kiss) So, what do you girls have planned for tonight?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, instead of being sad that tonight is my last night together with Rachel we thought we’d go out to dinner and celebrate the fact that Rachel is moving in with Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And also, my birthday.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s not your birthday.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What a mean thing to say! I would never tell you it’s not your birthday!
(Joey and Ross enter.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! So you guys have anything planned for the big last night?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, instead of just hanging out, we figure we’d do nothing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa, Knicks season opener tonight. I thought maybe you guys would come over and watch it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know Ross, not if you’re gonna talk about how you gave up a career in basketball to become a paleontologist.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I did give up a career in basketball to become a paleontologist!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pheebs, I was wondering…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re not dressed yet?! We’re supposed to start having fun in 15 minutes!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well and clearly not a minute sooner.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel, you are packed though right, I mean please tell me that you’re packed.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Of course I packed! Monica relax! I just wanted to ask Phoebe her opinion on what I should wear tonight.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: My God, I can’t get a minute of peace around this place.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! Monica’s just gonna kill you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, yeah, I know.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, what you’re wearing is fine for that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel, I need to borrow— You’re not packed !!!! You’re not packed even a little bit!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Surprise!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, no don’t get mad because look—this is what happened. So I-I started packing, then I realized, “What am I doing? I am lousy at packing!” Right? But you love packing! So, as a gift to you, on our last night, ta-da!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ll be coordinator! Oh my God! I’m so sorry, I didn’t get you anything! Okay, look everybody has to help! Okay? You can help, can’t you Phoebe?
content.parenthetical: grabs a bag of those Styrofoam peanuts

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I have plans.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re plans were with us.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s right.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, Chandler can make boxes, Ross can wrap, and Joey can lift things. Now Phoebe, go tell the guys they have to help out!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay! (To Rachel) Oh my God, thank you!!
[Cut to living room, Phoebe enters and closes Rachel’s door behind her.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hurry! Monica’s gonna make you pack! She’s got jobs for everyone! Now, it’s too late for me, but save your selves! (The guys scramble for the door.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay! The movers will be here in 11 hours. Rachel has not packed. Now, everybody has to help! Chandler, we’re gonna start with…
content.parenthetical: entering and interrupting the guy’s escape attempt

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh nope, I-I have plans with Joey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I thought you said you were going to do nothing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, but for the last time.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay fine, now Ross…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, but-but I can’t do it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’ve got Ben.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Because, because I’ve got Ben.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s almost 8 o’clock, it’s almost past his bedtime. Where-where is he?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He’s at a dinner party.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is he really coming? Because I can see right into your apartment!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Of course he is! What, do you think I’d just use my son as-as an excuse? What kind of father do you think I am?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, sorry. (Goes back to Rachel’s room.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I gotta go make a fake Ben.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is entering carrying two pizzas.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Here it is! Our last pizzas together as roommates.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I wish I’d know you were going to do that, I ordered Chinese.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh that’s okay. Hey, actually in a way it’s kinda nice. Me, bringing the food of my ancestors, you, the food of yours!
(Chandler stares at him, dumbfounded, then finally agrees.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Say, Joe, I had a strange idea of what we could do for our last night. What do you say we play a little uh, foosball for money?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What, are you crazy? You haven’t beaten me once since my injury plagued ’97 season. It would be easier if you just give me your money.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes it would. What do you say to $50?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, you’re on.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, let’s play! The big game, Italy vs. China, apparently.
(They start playing.)

content.description: Rachel’s bedroom, she’s in her closet bringing down her pair of roller blades from a top shelf.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohhhhhh, look it’s the roller blades.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh God!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You remember when we got these?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I guess you weren’t there. (They hug.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You guys, we said we were gonna have fun! Come on, hey, remember the time… (She starts laughing hysterically.) You don’t remember?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry Pheebs, I guess I’m just really said that I’m leaving.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m gonna miss you so much.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, this doesn’t have to be so sad though. Y’know? Maybe instead of just thinking about how much you’re gonna miss each other, you should like think of the things you’re not gonna miss.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t think there’s anything.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Come on, there’s gotta be something.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nope, she’s perfect.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I have one.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Good! Great! You can go first.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh well, I guess I’m not gonna miss the fact that you’re never allowed to move the phone pen. (Laughs. Monica lags behind the laugh a little bit.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Good that’s a good one. Okay, Monica, anything? Y’know? Does Rachel move the phone pen?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Aw, sometimes. Always, actually.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, good. There you go. Doesn’t anyone feel better?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Not just the phone pen. I never get my messages.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You get your messages!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, well I don’t think it really counts if you have to read them off the back of your hand after you fall asleep on the couch.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So-so, you missed a message from who? Chandler or your mom? Or Chandler? Or your mom?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Great! It worked! No one’s sad.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, they are just finishing up another game of foosball.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes! I win again! Ha-ha! That’s like 500 bucks you owe me! Whoo-ho-hoo! (Goes over to the fridge and starts opening and closing the door rapidly.) $500 that is a loooot of electricity! (By the way, there’s nothing in the fridge.) Whoo-ho-ho! (Notices the sparseness of the fridge.) I gotta buy some food.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, give me a chance to win my money back. Okay? Sudden death, one goal, $1,000.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You serious?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yes!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, get ready to owe me!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, here we go. Ready?

[In slow motion, as some haunty demonic music plays in the background, Joey throws the ball in, Chandler quits playing and goes for his Chinese food. Joey smacks the ball really hard, shooting it down the table. Chandler slowly takes a bite, the ball bounces off of the wall, heads back up the table, and scores the goal for Chandler.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No! No! No! No—(Joey looks at him)—one can beat me.
(In frustration, Joey kicks the table, breaking it.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See? Now, that’s why only the little fake men are supposed to do all the kicking.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the phone rings and Monica answers it as Rachel and Phoebe move a box into the living room.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello? (Listens) Oh, hi Ross! (To Rachel) See? Other people call me!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh, your brother. Score!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s up?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I’m just over here with Ben. I thought we’d say hi.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, put him on!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ben, say hi to Aunt Monica. (He holds the phone to the fake Ben he has created out of a pumpkin.) Oh, I guess he doesn’t feel like talking right now. He’s smiling though! Okay, talk to you later.

content.description: Rachel’s bedroom, Rachel is entering carrying two glasses of wine. She gives one to Phoebe, keeps one, and completely ignores Monica.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I think it was better when you guys were sad. Hey, uh, remember the roller blades?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You know what else I’m not gonna miss? “I’m Monica. I wash the toilet 17 times a day. Even if people are on it!”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: “Hi I’m Rachel, is my sweater too tight? No? Oh, I’d better wash it and shrink it!”

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: “I’m Monica, I don’t get phone messages from interesting people. Ever!”

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! I call her!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: “Oh my God, I love Ross! I hate Ross! I love Ross! I hate Ross!”

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: “Oh my God, I can’t find a boyfriend! So I guess I’ll just stumble across the hall and sleep with the first guy I find in there!”
(Monica picks up one of those boxes of hair curling things, dumps it in a box, and storms out.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, we should get a move on if we wanna make those dinner reservations. (Phoebe dumps a drawer full of makeup into a box.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is examining the broken foosball table as Chandler enters from his room.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Still broken?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This sucks man! The last night you’re here and I lose the two most important things in my life, the foosball table and $500.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, there are other ways of winning back your money, how about a little uh, a little Blackjack? (Holds up a deck of cards.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nah, not my game.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, uh, how about, how about—y’know what? We could play a new game. A new game, it’s fun.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, what’s it called?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Cups.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know how to play Cups.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’ll teach ya! Come on, come on, it’s really easy and really, really fun.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, here you go. (He deals out two cards each.) I have two queens, what do you have?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: A two and a five.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ho-ho, you win! 50 dollars!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah! Okay, let’s play again. (He deals out two cards each again.) What do you got?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: A four and a nine.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re kidding right?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No. Why?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well that’s a full cup! (Pays him again.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Damn! I am good at Cups!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is whining to Phoebe about Rachel.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m not talking to her!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, one of you has to take the first step! And it should be you, because she’s the one who’s leaving. It’s harder for her!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, maybe you’re right—She made fun of my phone pen!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know, I took it hard too.
(Monica goes into Rachel’s room.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Listen Rachel, I feel really bad about—What are you doing? (She sees that Rachel is unpacking.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m unpacking!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m not moving! (She re-hangs a picture, crookedly.) Is that picture straight?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It needs to go about 20 blocks to the left!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, y’know what? You’re the one who wants to make this big change and move in with Chandler! You should be the one to go! Why should I have to leave?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Because it’s my apartment!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well it’s mine too! What else you got?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How about, you’re moving!! (Grabs a bunch of clothes and throws them into a box. What follows is a brief sequence of Rachel unpacking and Monica packing the same stuff over and over again as Rachel chants “No.” and Monica chants “Yes.”)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look! This is ridiculous. We should be packing you!! (She knocks over Monica, grabs a box, and runs into the kitchen.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, how are you guys doing?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Great! Monica’s moving!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I am not!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh really?! Then how come all your stuff is in this box?! (Monica starts chasing Rachel around the table.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, you guys. You guys I think I know what’s going on here. Okay, you guys… STOP!! (They stop.) I know that, I know that you’re acting mad because you think that it’ll make it easier to leave. But deep down you’re still really sad. Deep-deep down.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No Phoebe I am mad!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, deep-deep-deep down!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I’m just mad!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Then keep running. (They resume the chase.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, they’re still playing Cups.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You win.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, what did you have?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It doesn’t matter because nothing beats a three and a six. That my friend is D-Cup. Okay, now much have you won so far?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, (counts the money) wow, 700.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Not 700 exactly?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Double it! (He does.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well you see in Cups, once you get $700, you have to double it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, I didn’t make up the rules. Now, after you receive the doubling bonus, you get uh, one card. Now that one card could be worth $100 bringing your total to 1,500. (Joey gets excited.) Don’t get to excited because that’s not gonna happen unless you get—No way! (He takes the top card, which is the two of clubs. Of course, any card would’ve won. Chandler pays him.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica carries a box out of Rachel’s room.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, this is the last box of your clothes. I’m just gonna label it, “What were you thinking?”

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Funny, because I was just gonna go across the hall and write that on Chandler.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey you guys, I don’t mean to make things worse, but umm, I don’t want to live with Rachel anymore.

content.speaker: Monica and Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re just so mean to each other! And I don’t want to end up like that with Rachel. I still like you!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, Phoebe that’s fine because I’m not moving.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa, Phoebe you gotta take her! Y’know I-I-I said some really bad stuff about her, but y’know Rachel has some good qualities that make her a good roommate.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh really? Like what Monica?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know she has 147,000 pairs of boots…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah, good start Mon.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: She lets you borrow them.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah and you stretch ‘em out with your big old clown feet.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you wanna live outside?! Because it’s gettin’ cold! (To Phoebe) She gets tons of catalogs and umm, she’ll fold down the pages of the things she thinks that I’d like.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What else?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: When I take a shower, she leaves me little notes on the mirror.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I do. I-I do, do that.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s nice. I like having things to read in the bathroom.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: When I fall asleep on the couch after reading, she covers me over with a blanket.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well y’know, I don’t want you to be cold.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And when I told her that I was gonna be moving in with Chandler, she was really supportive. (To Rachel) (Starts to cry) You were so great. You made it so easy. And now you have to leave. And I have to live with a boy!! (They both break down in tears.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, it’s gonna be fine.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay Rachel, I can’t wait to live with you! And you know what we should do? Bring Monica and then we could all live there together! We’ll have so much fun!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But honey, I think she’s moving in with Chandler.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh that’s right. You’re still set on that?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Kinda. (She hugs Phoebe and looks out the window. She moves closer to it to get a better look.) Oh my God!
[Cut to Ross’s apartment, he’s watching TV and eating some popcorn as the phone rings.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello? (Listens) Hey Mon, how’s the packing going? (Listens) Ben? He’s fine. Yeah, he’s right—Oh my God! (He looks over at the fake Ben and notices that the head has fallen off.) Get your head of your shirt there son! (He tries to push the pumpkin through the neck hole.) What? (Listens) Yeah, it’s a pumpkin. I’ll come pack.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, (Ohh, that’s the last time I’m ever gonna type that line. It’s just so sad.) Joey is entering, angrily.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’s wrong?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross and I were helping the girls pack, took a little break, I lost $1,500 to him in Cups!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wh-How did you lose at Cups?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The same way you lost. I started out with a King and a Queen, bamn! Ross gets a 2 and a 3. Then I get a Jack and a King, boom! Ross gets a 4 and a 5! Ross was getting the Cup card, the D-Cup, the Sittin’ Down Bonus! Meanwhile, I didn’t even get half a cup! Nothin’!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh man!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And he never played before either! Y’know what I think? I think beginner’s luck, very important in Cups.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, let’s play one more hand! One more!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, no, no more! I cannot lose another dime! I’m serious this time! In-in fact, look, there’s a—I wanna give you something. And let me give it too you know before I pawn it for Cups money. (He rolls the big white dog over) Now, I want you to have the big white dog as a kinda of a, y’know, thank you for being such a great roommate.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t take the big white dog! You love it!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s him, not it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, but wait—what if I bought it from you, y’know? And your nice gesture would be giving it to me at a reasonable price, say (Gets choked up) $1,500?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wait a second, I see what you’re trying to do here! You-you’re trying to give me money again!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: When did I try to give you money?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Over there! (Points to the couch) Before, with the bills! You tried to give some charity, I said “No,” you dropped it. Okay? Then we had a nice last night together, we had some fun, we gambled, nobody tried to give anybody any money! Now out of the blue, you start with the charity thing again!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m just trying to help you out! Okay? I wanna make sure that you’re okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I will be okay! Look Chandler, you gotta get it out of your head that I can’t take care of myself. Okay? Look, I’m not gonna miss you helping me out with money. The only thing that I’m gonna miss…is you. And now the dog.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, (And that’s the last time for that line, no more Chandler and Joey’s or Monica and Rachel’s, ever!) Joey and Ross are carrying the last table of Rachel’s. Rachel follows slowly, but is stopped by Monica.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey. Call me when you get there. Okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m really gonna miss you.
(They hug.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! I have your key. Here you go. (Hands it to Monica.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.
(Silence ensues.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God! This is silly, I’m gonna see you in a couple of hours! (They hug again.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Bye house!
(They break the embrace.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Bye Mon.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Bye.
(Monica closes the door and slowly walks into Rachel’s old and now empty room.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: She really left.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know. (He kisses her.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No problem roomie. (She turns around and hugs him.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Can I ask you a question?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sure!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What the hell is that dog doing here?! (She notices the dog sitting in the living room.)
(And with that, an era ends as Chandler moves in with Monica as Rachel moves in with Phoebe. It ‘tis a sad and happy time for Friends.)

content.description: Ross’s apartment, Chandler is trying to get Joey’s money back from Ross.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I invented the game of Cups as a way to give Joey money.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And now you want that money back.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Exactly.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Chandler, what kind of an idiot do you take me for? (As he picks up the fake Ben.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s not a real game! I made it up!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sorry you lost your money, but I won it fair and square.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: At a fake game!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Now, if you wanna try to make some of it back, I’d be glad to play you for it. But I should warn you, I am very good at Cups.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay! Now I assume the Saucer card came up when you played last.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hmm, let’s see if it comes up this time. (He looks at his cards and shrugs.)
